verses.verse: Praise<WH1984> you the Lord<WH3050>. O give thanks<WH3034> unto the Lord<WH3068>; for he is good<WH2896>: for his mercy<WH2617> endures for ever<WH5769>.
Who can utter<WH4448> the mighty acts<WH1369> of the Lord<WH3068>? who can show forth<WH8085> all his praise<WH8416>?
Blessed<WH835> are they that keep<WH8104> judgment<WH4941>, and he that does<WH6213> righteousness<WH6666> at all times<WH6256>.
Remember<WH2142> me<WH3068>, O Lord, with the favor<WH7522> that you bear unto your people<WH5971>: O visit<WH6485> me with your salvation<WH3444>;
That I may see<WH7200> the good<WH2896> of your chosen<WH972>, that I may rejoice<WH8055> in the gladness<WH8057> of your nation<WH1471>, that I may glory<WH1984> with your inheritance<WH5159>.
We have sinned<WH2398> with our fathers<WH1>, we have committed iniquity<WH5753>, we have done wickedly<WH7561>.

Our fathers<WH1> understood<WH7919> not your wonders<WH6381> in Egypt<WH4714>; they remembered<WH2142> not the multitude<WH7230> of your mercies<WH2617>; but provoked<WH4784> him at the sea<WH3220>, even at the Red<WH5488> sea<WH3220>.
Nevertheless he saved<WH3467> them for his name<WH8034>'s sake<WH1369>, that he might make his mighty power to be known<WH3045>.
He rebuked<WH1605> the Red<WH5488> sea<WH3220> also<WH2717>, and it was dried up: so he led<WH3212> them through the depths<WH8415>, as through the wilderness<WH4057>.
And he saved<WH3467> them from the hand<WH3027> of him that hated<WH8130> them<WH1350>, and redeemed them from the hand<WH3027> of the enemy<WH341>.
And the waters<WH4325> covered<WH3680> their enemies<WH6862>: there was not one<WH259> of them left<WH3498>.
Then believed<WH539> they his words<WH1697>; they sang<WH7891> his praise<WH8416>.
They soon<WH4116> forgot<WH7911> his works<WH4639>; they waited<WH2442> not for his counsel<WH6098>:
But lusted<WH183> exceedingly<WH8378> in the wilderness<WH4057>, and tempted<WH5254> God<WH410> in the desert<WH3452>.
And he gave<WH5414> them their request<WH7596>; but sent<WH7971> leanness<WH7332> into their soul<WH5315>.
They envied<WH7065> Moses<WH4872> also in the camp<WH4264>, and Aaron<WH175> the saint<WH6918> of the Lord<WH3068>.
The earth<WH776> opened<WH6605> and swallowed up<WH1104> Dathan<WH1885>, and covered<WH3680> the company<WH5712> of Abiram<WH48>.
And a fire<WH784> was kindled<WH1197> in their company<WH5712>; the flame<WH3852> burned up<WH3857> the wicked<WH7563>.
They made<WH6213> a calf<WH5695> in Horeb<WH2722>, and worshiped<WH7812> the molten image<WH4541>.
Thus they changed<WH4171> their glory<WH3519> into the likeness<WH8403> of a ox<WH7794> that eat<WH398> grass<WH6212>.
They forgot<WH7911> God<WH410> their savior<WH3467>, which had done<WH6213> great things<WH1419> in Egypt<WH4714>;
Wondrous works<WH6381> in the land<WH776> of Ham<WH2526>, and terrible things<WH3372> by the Red<WH5488> sea<WH3220>.

Therefore he said<WH559> that he would destroy<WH8045> them<WH3884>, had not Moses<WH4872> his chosen<WH972> stood<WH5975> before<WH6440> him in the breach<WH6556>, to turn away<WH7725> his wrath<WH2534>, lest he should destroy them<WH7843>.
Yes<WH3988>, they despised the pleasant<WH2532> land<WH776>, they believed<WH539> not his word<WH1697>:
But murmured<WH7279> in their tents<WH168>, and listened<WH8085> not unto the voice<WH6963> of the Lord<WH3068>.
Therefore he lifted up<WH5375> his hand<WH3027> against them<WH5307>, to overthrow them in the wilderness<WH4057>:
To overthrow<WH5307> their seed<WH2233> also among the nations<WH1471>, and to scatter<WH2219> them in the lands<WH776>.
They joined<WH6775> themselves also unto Baal<WH1187>â€“peor, and ate<WH398> the sacrifices<WH2077> of the dead<WH4191>.
Thus they provoked him to anger<WH3707> with their inventions<WH4611>: and the plague<WH4046> broke in upon them<WH6555>.
Then stood up<WH5975> Phinehas<WH6372>, and executed judgment<WH6419>: and so the plague<WH4046> was stayed<WH6113>.
And that was counted<WH2803> unto him for righteousness<WH6666> unto all<WH1755> generations<WH1755> for<WH5704> evermore<WH5769>.
They angered<WH7107> him also at the waters<WH4325> of strife<WH4808>, so that it went ill<WH3415> with Moses for their sakes<WH4872>:
Because they provoked<WH4784> his spirit<WH7307>, so that he spoke unadvisedly<WH981> with his lips<WH8193>.
They did not destroy<WH8045> the nations<WH5971>, concerning whom the Lord<WH3068> commanded them<WH559>:
But were mingled<WH6148> among the heathen<WH1471>, and learned<WH3925> their works<WH4639>.
And they served<WH5647> their idols<WH6091>: which were a snare unto them<WH4170>.
Yes<WH2076>, they sacrificed their sons<WH1121> and their daughters<WH1323> unto demons<WH7700>,

And shed<WH8210> innocent<WH5355> blood<WH1818>, even the blood<WH1818> of their sons<WH1121> and of their daughters<WH1323>, whom they sacrificed<WH2076> unto the idols<WH6091> of Canaan<WH3667>: and the land<WH776> was polluted<WH2610> with blood<WH1818>.
Thus were they defiled<WH2930> with their own works<WH4639>, and went a whoring<WH2181> with their own inventions<WH4611>.
Therefore was the wrath<WH639> of the Lord<WH3068> kindled<WH2734> against his people<WH5971>, so much that he abhorred<WH8581> his own inheritance<WH5159>.
And he gave<WH5414> them into the hand<WH3027> of the heathen<WH1471>; and they that hated<WH8130> them ruled over them<WH4910>.
Their enemies<WH341> also oppressed<WH3905> them<WH3665>, and they were brought into subjection under their hand<WH3027>.
Many<WH7227> times<WH6471> did he deliver<WH5337> them<WH4784>; but they provoked him with their counsel<WH6098>, and were brought low<WH4355> for their iniquity<WH5771>.
Nevertheless he regarded<WH7200> their affliction<WH6862>, when he heard<WH8085> their cry<WH7440>:
And he remembered<WH2142> for them his covenant<WH1285>, and repented<WH5162> according to the multitude<WH7230> of his mercies<WH2617>.
He made<WH5414> them also to be pitied<WH7356> of<WH6440> all those that carried them captives<WH7617>.

Save<WH3467> us<WH3068>, O Lord our God<WH430>, and gather<WH6908> us from among the heathen<WH1471>, to give thanks<WH3034> unto your holy<WH6944> name<WH8034>, and to triumph<WH7623> in your praise<WH8416>.

Blessed<WH1288> be the Lord<WH3068> God<WH430> of Israel<WH3478> from everlasting<WH5769> to everlasting<WH5769>: and let all the people<WH5971> say<WH559>, Amen<WH543>. Praise<WH1984> you the Lord<WH3050>.
